revised_title: An Analysis of the Transverse Electrical Impedance of Striated Muscle: Implications for Muscle Fiber Properties
tldr: The authors conducted a study on the transverse electrical impedance of striated muscle and found two time-dependent impedance elements. They analyzed the properties of the muscle fiber, including resistance and capacitance, and suggested that these properties could indicate the resistivity of the myoplasm and the capacitance of the surface membrane of the fiber. The findings have implications for understanding the structure and function of muscle fibers.
